title: Funding requests received by Sheffield City Council to participate in Doncaster Sheffield Airport

content:
Dear Sheffield City Council,
Without prejudice to the generality of the foregoing, I am writing to make a formal request under the Freedom of Information Act 2000 for the following information. regarding Doncaster Sheffield Airport (DSA). This relates purely to Sheffield City Council as recipient of such request.
Since the closure of Doncaster Sheffield Airport (DSA) in November 2022, has Sheffield City Council formally received from City of Doncaster Council or its Mayor, Ros Jones, a request for financial assistance or shared financial responsibility for the airport’s reopening from:
a) Sheffield City Council itself?
b) Sheffield City Council Through the SYMCA Cabinet, other local authorities within South Yorkshire or neighbouring regions?
[to be clear, this is not related to Doncaster’s share of its own Gainshare funding but for a contribution from  Sheffield City Council alone  and/or with other neighbouring councils collectively through any funding envelope including SYMCA]
I would like to know if Doncaster Council or its representatives including the Mayor of Doncaster Ros Jones have approached or requested any financial contributions or funding from you,  specifically Sheffield City Council, or other local authorities collectively within neighbouring South Yorkshire, including SYMCA, for the reinstatement of the airport.
Specifically, I am interested in any correspondence, meetings, or discussions where Doncaster Council may have sought financial support or contributions for Doncaster Sheffield Airport from Sheffield City Council.
If such requests exist, please provide
a) Details of the nature of the assistance sought (e.g., direct funding, loans, resource sharing).
b) Copies of correspondence (emails, letters, meeting minutes) related to these requests, or any formal documents relating to this matter.
c) Records of responses from Sheffield City Council or through other authorities, namely SYMCA.
Thank you for your assistance.
Yours sincerely,
Wai M Yau

Dear Wai M Yau,
Thank you for your request for information relating to funding requests

Dear Wai M Yau,
Thank you for your request for information relating to funding requests
received by Sheffield City Council to participate in Doncaster Sheffield
Airport which we received on 19/02/2025.
Please find Sheffield City Council’s response to your request set out
below:
a) Sheffield City Council itself? No
b) Sheffield City Council Through the SYMCA Cabinet, other local
authorities within South Yorkshire or neighbouring regions? No
[to be clear, this is not related to Doncaster’s share of its own
Gainshare funding but for a contribution from Sheffield City Council alone
and/or with other neighbouring councils collectively through any funding
envelope including SYMCA]
I would like to know if Doncaster Council or its representatives including
the Mayor of Doncaster Ros Jones have approached or requested any
financial contributions or funding from you,  specifically Sheffield City
Council, or other local authorities collectively within neighbouring South
Yorkshire, including SYMCA, for the reinstatement of the airport.
Specifically, I am interested in any correspondence, meetings, or
discussions where Doncaster Council may have sought financial support or
contributions for Doncaster Sheffield Airport from Sheffield City Council.
If such requests exist, please provide
a) Details of the nature of the assistance sought (e.g., direct funding,
loans, resource sharing). None have been sought from Sheffield City
Council
b) Copies of correspondence (emails, letters, meeting minutes) related to
these requests, or any formal documents relating to this matter. No
requests have been received so there are no documents to disclose.
c) Records of responses from Sheffield City Council or through other
authorities, namely SYMCA. No requests have been received so there are no
documents to disclose.
If you have any queries about this response, please do not hesitate to
contact us.
The information provided in this response is available for re-use under
the terms of the Open Government Licence v3.0. The terms of the OGL can be
found [1]here. When re-using the information, Sheffield City Council
requires you to include the following attribution statement: “Contains
public sector information obtained from Sheffield City Council and
licensed under the Open Government Licence v3.0.”
If you are unhappy with the response you have received in relation to your
request, you are entitled to have this reviewed. You can ask for an
internal review by replying to this email. Internal review requests should
be submitted within 40 working days from the date of this response.
If you remain dissatisfied with the outcome of your internal review, you
can contact the Information Commissioner’s Office. Please see
[2]
https://ico.org.uk/make-a-complaint/offi...
for further details.
Kind Regards,
Sheffield City Council
PO Box 1283
Sheffield, S1 1UJ
